msgSnippet: keep the progress bar in view (or the terminal if using textui -- you will see sudden sysouts)... If you need more than that, look at the code in the swingui
messageBody:
keep the progress bar in view (or the terminal if using textui -- you
will see sudden sysouts)...

If you need more than that, look at the code in the swingui where it
adds failures and errors to its underlying list, you should be able to
add a system beep there.

=jason

Subject: [junit] Notification


Is there any built in possibility in junit (or in the swing
testrunner) to notify the user as soon as

a) there's an error or failure
or
b) all tests have finished

or at least an event for which I could define the action to take in
these cases?

While our complete tests are running (takes about 600-700 sec) I want
to do something different but I don't want to loose time when they
have finished or if there is an error. So it would be sufficient if
there were a loud and clear "beep".

Thanks,

Markus
